pages.title: Huainan Mat
pages.text: $(l)Temporal Range:$() Neoproterozoic (Tonian)$(br2)$(l)Habitat:$() Marine$(br)$(l)Method of Obtaining:$() Shears

The Huainan Mat is a freely-represented block based on fossils from the Upper Tonian, found in the Liulaobei Formation, North China. It is based on the tubular 'shelly' Huainan Biota, which derives its name from the Huainan Group, which comprises of Sinosabellidites, Pararenicola, Trachyhystrichosphaera and Protoarenicola to name a few, all of which are several cm in size.
